snippet: The California Supreme Court is considering a disciplinary rule, mandated by the State Legislature and drafted by the state Bar Association, that would prohibit lawyers from coercing sex from clients. But Patricia Durham of Rancho Cucamonga can't ...
lead_paragraph: The California Supreme Court is considering a disciplinary rule, mandated by the State Legislature and drafted by the state Bar Association, that would prohibit lawyers from coercing sex from clients. But Patricia Durham of Rancho Cucamonga can't wait. Convinced that her divorce lawyer, James McDaniel of Ontario, had neglected her case after she spurned his sexual advances, Ms. Durham sued him for malpractice and intentional infliction of emotional distress.

headline.main: At the Bar; After a woman accuses her lawyer of sexual harassment, others tell their own horror stories.
